FARQUHARSON ON ENGINE 205 WAS NOT AWARE OF THEUNSUCCESSFUL ATTEMPT; HE RELEASED HIS BRAKES AND DRIFTED IN A WESTERLY DIRECTION. ENGINE ATTENDENTT. FORD POSITIONED HIMSELF IN THE FIREMAN'S SEAT. ENGINE ATTEND. L. RANDALL THE INSTRUCTED R. FARQUHARSON ON ENG 205 TO BACK UP FORA SECOND HITCH ATTEMPT. 71112MBT02-d-11-12-87-ATK.Narrative: TRAIN 8910 ARRIVED AT BACK BAY STATION AT ABOUT 7:20 AM, ON 11/12/87 AND UNLOADED PASSENGERS. TRAIN8910 WAS HELD AT BACK BAY STATION DUE TO TERMINAL CONGESTION AT SOUTH STATION CAUSED BY SNOW AND ICYCONDITIONS OF SWITCHES. TRAIN 8110 ARRIVED AT BACK BAY PLATFORM AND DETRAINED PASSENGERS THROUGH THE FIRST THREE (3) CARS ONTO PLATFORM. WHILE THIS WAS IN PROGRESS TRAIN 8114 PASSED WAYSIDE SIGNAL NO.226.2 ON TRACK 2 WHICH DISPLAYED AN APPROACH INDICATION. THE ENGINEER STATED IN ADDITION TO THE ASPECT OF THE WAYSIDE SIGNAL, THE CAB SIGNAL WAS ALSO DISPLAYING AN APPROACH ASPECT.ENGINEER BEGAN TO REDUCE HIS SPEED TO 30 MPH. HE THEN OBSERVED STANDING AT BACK BAY STATION TRAIN 8110 AND IMMEDIATELYPLACED TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY. A REAR-END COLLISION OCCURRED BETWEEN TRAINS 8110 AND 8114. POST ACCIDENT MANDATORY DRUG TESTING OF ALL EMPLOYEES INVOLVED INDENTIFIED NO DRUG OR ALCOHOL INVOLVEMENT. THEPRESENCE OF CODEINE (BELOW REPORTABLE LIMITS) WAS DETECTED IN THE URINE OF ASSISTANT COND. K. LAFOUNTAINE DUE TO MEDICATION PRESCRIBED FOR COLD/FLU SYMPTOMNoneNoneNoneNone
